section_purpose: This section describes how the GNN-derived phase predictions are integrated into a CDCL SAT solver to enhance its phase selection heuristics.
key_points: The primary method for integrating neural predictions is to initialize the phases of variables in the CDCL solver based on the model's predictions.
The authors implemented this approach by modifying the state-of-the-art solver Kissat to support initialization with their NeuroBack predictions.
The resulting integrated system is named NeuroBack-Kissat.

algorithms: Integration method: Initializing CDCL solver variable phases based on external neural predictions
architectures: NeuroBack-Kissat (Kissat solver modified to accept NeuroBack phase initialization)

dependencies: Section 4.2 on GNN-based phase prediction for the source of the predictions
Background on CDCL SAT solving (Section 2) and the Kissat solver
reproducibility_notes: The specific integration method: phase initialization in the CDCL solver.
The base solver chosen: Kissat (Biere & Fleury, 2022).
The name of the integrated system: NeuroBack-Kissat.
